posts.post_content:
Even if you don't plan on using it, at least add it in as a sideboard utility. It blows mill decks out of the water.   
  
If you think that hard casting it is too difficult, then you don't know how to use the set. Spawns and Eldrazi lands make up most of the mana cost. that is what's supposed to happen.
posts.html:

If you think that hard casting it is too difficult, then you don't know how to use the set. Spawns and Eldrazi lands make up most of the mana cost. that is what's supposed to happen.

Posted By: WhiteyMcFly (4/16/2010 5:16:44 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Does anybody remember when Darksteel Colossus and Phyrexian Dreadnought were considered to be some of the most powerful creatures ever printed (not efficient necessarily, just really big and powerful).  
  
These make them look like nothing.  
Kozilek and Ulamog are most likely more powerful than Colossus, and they cost roughly the same.  
And there is no contest for Emrakul.  
  
The worst thing is, as things stand in Standard, you'll be seeing Kozilek and Ulamog turn 5-6, and Emrakul only 2-3 turns later (if you survive that long).  
  
You'll be seeing them turn 3 or sooner in Extended with Hypergenesis Cascade.
posts.html:

And there is no contest for Emrakul.

The worst thing is, as things stand in Standard, you'll be seeing Kozilek and Ulamog turn 5-6, and Emrakul only 2-3 turns later (if you survive that long).

You'll be seeing them turn 3 or sooner in Extended with Hypergenesis Cascade.

posts.post_content: No no no no no no. This is bad card design wizards. BAD. You do not print something like this that essentially hoses your opponent and gives them little to no hope of recovering. You make expensive cards to be strong but have some kind of drawback that makes it riskier to play them. The flavor is also quite off on a card like this. Why would some plane devouring monster bow to the wishes of some little fleshy being squeaking out orders from the surface it is currently destroying. The destruction it causes from tearing around shouldn't be one sided. It should harm everyone involved.

posts.post_content:
lol has anyone else noticed the wording for its take another turn ability  
"When you **CAST!** Emrakul, take an extra turn after this one."  
he doesn't even need to resolve for you to have an extra turn.  
  
so if he is countered...such as by exiling target spell or simply time stopping your turn. but personally i'd just steal him with a [Gather Specimens](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gather Specimens). you'd still get your extra turn.  
  
Though i'm not gonna enjoy arguing with some of the more rules challenged players i know that just because it says "Protection from Coloured Spells" means i can't block it with a [deadly recluse](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=deadly recluse) and destroy it

posts.post_content: My milling efforts are in vain when I failed to notice the 'shuffle you library' context. And the lesson is, read carefully before you decide to make a move. Posted By: HairlessThoctar (4/21/2010 2:40:26 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
After freaking out for a little while about how unfair this card looks, I began to realize three things.
  
   
1) Hardly anyone will ever be able to hard cast this, so time walking doesn't matter.
  
   
2) Even with protection, several things will stop this card from a simple oblivion ring or journey to nowhere, to drana or kalitas bloodchief ability. It can still die to wrath's/day of judgement, and sac. affects like consuming vapors, so maybe not as hard to get rid of as it seems.
  
   
3) I can win the game before this ever sees play, in extended there's already several turn 3 wins (hyper gen really didn't need this card since it worked already), and in standard aggro creatures kill an opponent before they have 15 mana.
  
   
All in all, I am more impressed by ulamog, with his basic indestructibility, and enter play vindication/maelstrom pulse. Plus he is more cost efficient.
posts.html:
After freaking out for a little while about how unfair this card looks, I began to realize three things.

1) Hardly anyone will ever be able to hard cast this, so time walking doesn't matter.

2) Even with protection, several things will stop this card from a simple oblivion ring or journey to nowhere, to drana or kalitas bloodchief ability. It can still die to wrath's/day of judgement, and sac. affects like consuming vapors, so maybe not as hard to get rid of as it seems.

3) I can win the game before this ever sees play, in extended there's already several turn 3 wins (hyper gen really didn't need this card since it worked already), and in standard aggro creatures kill an opponent before they have 15 mana.

All in all, I am more impressed by ulamog, with his basic indestructibility, and enter play vindication/maelstrom pulse. Plus he is more cost efficient.
